intro: Trichilia lepidota subsp. ferruginea, commonly known as the rusty trichilia, is a tropical tree species native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and other valuable hardwoods. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that appear in clusters. Its fruits are woody capsules containing several seeds, and the tree is often found in lowland rainforests. The subspecies is distinguished by its reddish-brown bark and the presence of rust-colored hairs on its leaves.
